page.title: 08HOLT'S MINI MUSEUM
page.content: There is an interesting character in Holt who has a collection of old and curious things from the village. She started her collection when she renovated her house and found lots of old coins, bottles and little childrens' toys. She decided to keep the things and start a mini-museum. It was open to the public from 1975 to 1982, but then there wasn't enough room to keep all the exhibits on show. Children in the village are still allowed to visit the house, by arrangement though. When the lady took away part of the wall in her house, she and her husband found some wattle and daub plaster and also a wall that did not belong to either of the two houses that they were making into one. It even had a window!
